description.narrative: (i) The Company''s activities are focused on improving UB''s urban infrastructure. As such, they have a direct and immediate development impact with respect to improvements in living standards and inefficiency of doing business in Mongolia''s capital. In particular, the Company''s pipeline of properties scheduled for completion in the near future includes socially important developments, such as 1,617 affordable housing units in an innovative and replicable "Shine Ger" project with the goal to make home ownership affordable for young professional families; (ii) MCSP is an important source of indirect employment with 4,782 indirect employees (e.g. contractors); (iii) Through increased purchasing local materials and services, the expansion of MCSP activities will strengthen the Company''s linkages to the local economy; (iv) MCSP is committed to bringing international property development standards and best practices to a country where the quality of construction needs to be drastically improved; (v) The MCS Tower included in the Project will contribute to the development of the UB business infrastructure that lacks quality office buildings at this point in time.

The MCS Group of companies (MCS Group or the Sponsor), IFCs repeat client and one of Mongolias leading business groups active in (i) distributing fast-moving consumer goods; (ii) beverage manufacturing; (ii) mobile communications and information technologies; (iii) civil engineering and infrastructure development, (iv) mining, as well as in a number of other industry sectors, is expanding the scale of its property development operations, which are currently focused on a large-scale affordable housing development in Ulaanbaatar (UB). MCS Groups property-focused subsidiary MCS Properties Holdings Ltd (BVI) (MCS Property, MCSP or the Company) has requested a long-term IFC loan of up to US$60 million, which will be used (i) to complete the Companys affordable housing development Shine Ger in UB; (ii) to build an affordable housing residential complex in the vicinity of the Ukhaa Khudag (UHG) mine site, 500 kilometers to the south of UB, as well as (iii) to develop an office tower, which will be an important contribution to the Mongolian capital business infrastructure, and a school building in UB (the Project).

name.narrative: The office tower included in the Project will be built in the central areas of UB. The Shine Ger affordable housing development is being constructed on the outskirts of UB, approximately 50 kilometers from the central part of the city. In addition, the Project includes affordable housing in the vicinity of the UHG mine site, 500 kilometers to the south of UB. All the Project sites have adequate access to all the necessary infrastructure.
